name: Deloitte India (Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu India LLP)
description: Deloitte India provides technical and management consulting services to central and state governments, development partners, and healthcare providers. The health practice focuses on digital health transformation, public health system strengthening, NHM strategy, PPP design, health financing, and analytics for decision-making. Deloitte recruits public health professionals for consulting and project management roles that require both technical and operational knowledge of government health programs.

extraInfo.Public Health Focus / Services: Health systems consulting, health financing, NHM/NHM support, digital health strategy, analytics, hospital and health system reforms
extraInfo.Typical Roles Recruited: Consultant, Senior Consultant, Manager, Health Analyst, Public Health Expert

name: Ernst & Young (EY) India – Government and Public Sector Advisory
description: EY India’s Government and Public Sector (GPS) team delivers advisory support to ministries, state governments, and development partners in public health, health financing, and program implementation. They support digital health initiatives, NHM and disease-specific reforms, and large-scale monitoring and evaluation assignments. EY regularly recruits public health professionals as consultants, analysts, and program managers with a focus on systems design and strategic advisory.

extraInfo.Public Health Focus / Services: Health policy, NHM and NTEP support, data systems, digital health, PPP, monitoring and evaluation, strategic planning
extraInfo.Typical Roles Recruited: Consultant, Senior Consultant, Project Manager, Policy Analyst, M&E Specialist

name: PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) India
description: PwC India’s Health Advisory team works with ministries, state governments, and private sector players on healthcare strategy, health financing, digital systems, PPP, and quality improvement. They partner with institutions such as the World Bank, UN agencies, and NHM on major health systems reforms and analytics projects. PwC frequently recruits MPH and MBBS professionals for consulting and project implementation roles focusing on evidence-based decision support.

extraInfo.Public Health Focus / Services: Health system strengthening, PPP, hospital management, digital health, analytics, and evaluation of donor-funded projects
extraInfo.Typical Roles Recruited: Consultant, Health Policy Specialist, Senior Associate, Data Analyst, Project Manager

name: KPMG India
description: KPMG India’s healthcare and life sciences division supports public health reforms through strategy, data analytics, and digital transformation. They assist NHM, state governments, and development partners in designing systems for health financing, human resources, quality improvement, and PPP implementation. The firm recruits professionals with backgrounds in medicine, public health, and data science for technical and project management consulting roles.

extraInfo.Public Health Focus / Services: Public health strategy, NHM and state program support, digital health, PPP, analytics, CSR advisory
extraInfo.Typical Roles Recruited: Associate Consultant, Consultant, Manager, Senior Manager (Healthcare Advisory)

name: Boston Consulting Group (BCG) India
description: BCG partners with national and state governments, donor agencies, and corporates on healthcare and public health transformation. The firm supports Ayushman Bharat, vaccine logistics, digital health ecosystems, and UHC design. It recruits consultants and project leaders with strong analytical and health systems expertise, and often collaborates with NITI Aayog, MoHFW, and international foundations on flagship initiatives.

extraInfo.Public Health Focus / Services: Health system reform, universal health coverage, vaccine logistics, health financing, innovation strategy
extraInfo.Typical Roles Recruited: Associate, Consultant, Project Leader, Public Health Expert, Analyst

name: McKinsey & Company (India)
description: McKinsey’s India Public and Social Sector practice works with governments, multilaterals, and corporations to strengthen healthcare delivery, design CSR initiatives, and optimize health financing models. It has supported national missions on health and nutrition, as well as private sector CSR strategy in health. McKinsey recruits generalist consultants and healthcare implementation specialists with expertise in public health systems and data analytics.

extraInfo.Public Health Focus / Services: Health financing, delivery innovation, private sector engagement, CSR health strategy, government reform
extraInfo.Typical Roles Recruited: Consultant, Implementation Manager, Analyst, Engagement Manager

name: IQVIA India
description: IQVIA supports pharmaceutical companies, governments, and global health organizations with data analytics, real-world evidence generation, and monitoring & evaluation. In India, IQVIA also works with development partners and CSR arms on TB, HIV, and NCD program analytics, and population health studies. They hire analysts, data scientists, and consultants with strong public health and data backgrounds.

extraInfo.Category: Healthcare Data Analytics and Research Company
extraInfo.Public Health Focus / Services: Health data analytics, pharmacoepidemiology, market access, monitoring and evaluation of health programs
extraInfo.Typical Roles Recruited: Health Analyst, Data Scientist, Consultant, Epidemiologist, Health Economist

name: ACCESS Health International (India)
description: ACCESS Health International is a global think tank and implementation partner working on digital health systems, financing reform, and innovative health models. In India, it supports Ayushman Bharat and other UHC initiatives through technical assistance, data analytics, and health systems policy. ACCESS Health recruits programme managers, health systems analysts, and consultants for design and implementation support.

extraInfo.Public Health Focus / Services: Digital health, health financing, aging and NCD care, health systems design, PPP advisory
extraInfo.Typical Roles Recruited: Consultant, Programme Manager, Policy Analyst, Research Associate

name: Tata Trusts – Health Portfolio
description: Tata Trusts funds and implements large-scale health programmes in maternal and child health, nutrition, cancer control, and public health system strengthening. Its technical teams provide implementation and policy support to national and state governments. The health vertical recruits programme officers, consultants, and monitoring specialists with a strong grounding in community health and systems design.

extraInfo.Public Health Focus / Services: Maternal and child health, cancer control, health systems strengthening, nutrition, digital health innovations
extraInfo.Typical Roles Recruited: Programme Officer, Consultant (Public Health), M&E Specialist, Technical Lead

name: Reliance Foundation – Health Initiatives
description: Reliance Foundation implements health outreach and telemedicine programmes across rural India. Its health vertical focuses on improving access to primary care, maternal health, and preventive services, leveraging digital platforms. The foundation hires programme managers, technical specialists, data and M&E staff, and public health experts for planning and field oversight roles.

extraInfo.Public Health Focus / Services: Rural health, primary healthcare, telemedicine, maternal and child health, emergency response
extraInfo.Typical Roles Recruited: Programme Manager, Monitoring Officer, Field Coordinator, Consultant (Public Health)

name: Aditya Birla CSR – Health Initiatives
description: Aditya Birla CSR Foundation runs health and nutrition programmes through partnerships with NGOs and local governments. Activities include maternal and child health, NCD screening, mobile medical units, and community health education. The foundation employs public health and social development professionals for project coordination, monitoring, and partnership management roles.

extraInfo.Public Health Focus / Services: Maternal health, nutrition, NCD screening, health camps, mobile medical units, sanitation and hygiene
extraInfo.Typical Roles Recruited: Project Coordinator, CSR Health Manager, M&E Officer, Community Health Specialist

name: Philips India Healthcare
description: Philips India collaborates with the government and private providers to implement digital health and diagnostic technology in primary and secondary care. It supports projects on tele-ICU, maternal health devices, and imaging systems in partnership with NHM and CSR initiatives. Philips recruits professionals for health systems partnerships, programme management, and analytics roles.

extraInfo.Public Health Focus / Services: Digital health solutions, telemedicine, diagnostics, maternal health devices, health systems partnerships
extraInfo.Typical Roles Recruited: Programme Manager (Public Health), Partnerships Lead, Data Analyst, CSR Health Specialist

name: Siemens Healthineers India
description: Siemens Healthineers supports both private and public health systems through diagnostic technology, imaging solutions, and AI-driven analytics. It collaborates with government initiatives and donor-funded health technology strengthening projects. The company hires consultants, project leads, and biomedical engineers with expertise in health systems and digital health implementation.

extraInfo.Public Health Focus / Services: Diagnostics, radiology, AI-based imaging, health systems consulting, biomedical capacity building
extraInfo.Typical Roles Recruited: Consultant (Health Systems), Project Manager, Biomedical Specialist, Data Analyst

name: GE Healthcare India
description: GE Healthcare India implements partnerships for maternal and newborn health, imaging, diagnostics, and capacity building in biomedical equipment maintenance. It supports PPPs for radiology and health technology management with state governments. GE recruits project managers, health system specialists, and engineers involved in public health innovation and service delivery partnerships.

extraInfo.Public Health Focus / Services: Maternal and newborn health, diagnostics, radiology, PPP in imaging, skill development in biomedical equipment management
extraInfo.Typical Roles Recruited: Health Systems Specialist, Project Manager, Biomedical Engineer, Consultant

name: National Health Mission (NHM) / State Health Societies
description: The National Health Mission (and its state and district health societies) directly implements large-scale public health programmes across India in maternal and child health, communicable and non-communicable diseases, community processes/ASHA support, health & wellness centres, and quality improvement. States continuously hire programme managers, district consultants, epidemiologists, data/MIS officers, quality-of-care coordinators, and public health specialists on contract, often under titles like ‘District Programme Manager’, ‘Epidemiologist-IDSP’, ‘Community Process Consultant’, or ‘Quality Consultant’. This is one of the most reliable hiring channels for applied public health implementation experience at district/block level.

extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: RMNCH+A, NCD screening, HWCs/primary care, immunization, health systems strengthening, quality of care, community processes, data/MIS
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: District Programme Manager, State Programme Manager, Epidemiologist, Data/MIS Officer, Quality of Care Consultant, Community Process Coordinator
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: All states and most districts

name: National Health Systems Resource Centre (NHSRC)
description: NHSRC is the Government of India’s in-house technical support unit to the National Health Mission. It supports states on planning and budgeting, quality of care standards (LaQshya, NQAS), public health management, HRH strategy, community processes/ASHAs, and health financing reforms. NHSRC routinely deploys consultants and senior consultants who sit in Delhi or are seconded to state governments to drive programme implementation, monitoring, and policy translation. It is one of the most consistent recruiters of MPH / MD-Community Medicine profiles in India.

extraInfo.Category: MoHFW Technical Support Agency to NHM
extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: Primary health care (AB-HWC), health systems design, quality of care (LaQshya, NQAS), community processes, HRH planning, health financing
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Consultant – Public Health Planning, Senior Consultant – Quality Improvement, Community Processes Specialist, Health Financing Analyst
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: New Delhi HQ + deputations/placements to State NHMs

name: State Health Systems Resource Centres / State Technical Support Units (SHSRC / TSU / SPMU)
description: Many states have SHSRCs, TSUs or State Programme Management Units that act as embedded technical cells for NHM, focusing on programme planning, analytics, supportive supervision, quality improvement, and roll-out of national initiatives like HWCs, LaQshya, and NCD screening. These units directly recruit consultants, district programme managers, quality coordinators, M&E officers, data analysts, and training coordinators. Roles are hands-on and usually district- or state-posted, making them core employers for applied public health implementation professionals.

extraInfo.Category: State-level Technical Support Units embedded in Health Dept/NHM
extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: RMNCH+A, NCDs, urban health, quality improvement, data systems and monitoring, training/supervision of frontline workforce
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Public Health Consultant, District Programme Manager, M&E Officer, Quality of Care Lead, Training/Capacity Building Coordinator
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: Every state (state HQ + high priority districts)

name: Integrated Disease Surveillance Programme (IDSP) / National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC)
description: IDSP under NCDC coordinates epidemic intelligence and real-time surveillance of priority diseases in every state and most districts. It also supports AMR and zoonotic surveillance. Implementation staff include epidemiologists and data managers embedded in state and district surveillance units. These roles involve active outbreak investigation, data review, and rapid field coordination with local health authorities, making IDSP one of the best direct applied epidemiology pathways for young public health professionals.

extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: Surveillance, outbreak investigation, AMR, zoonotic diseases, epidemic intelligence, rapid response
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Epidemiologist (IDSP), State Surveillance Officer, Microbiologist, Data Manager, Entomologist
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: MoHFW (Delhi) + every State Surveillance Unit + most District Surveillance Units

name: Doctors Without Borders / Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) India
description: MSF delivers direct medical and psychosocial care in crisis, conflict, outbreak, and underserved settings. In India, MSF has implemented DR-TB treatment support, HIV/HCV care models, Kala-azar care, sexual and gender-based violence survivor services, and mental health support for excluded populations. They hire clinicians, programme managers, counsellors, mental health professionals, pharmacists, lab leads, and health promoters for direct service delivery and project coordination.

extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: Drug-resistant TB, HIV, hepatitis C, infectious disease outbreak care, gender-based violence response, mental health in crisis-affected/marginalised groups
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Medical Coordinator, Project Coordinator, Health Promotion Officer, Counsellor, Mental Health Officer, TB/HIV Programme Manager
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: India projects (often urban slums/underserved pockets and crisis-affected districts) + international missions

name: LEPRA Society (LEPRA India)
description: LEPRA works with national and state programmes to detect, treat, and prevent complications of leprosy and lymphatic filariasis, and to reduce disability and stigma. Implementation includes active case finding, community-based morbidity management (lymphoedema care), disability prevention, self-care groups, and rehabilitation. LEPRA recruits programme officers, district coordinators, physiotherapists/disability specialists, M&E staff, and field supervisors to work within government systems in high-burden states.

extraInfo.Category: Public health NGO / Disease control NGO
extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: Leprosy, lymphatic filariasis, disability prevention & rehabilitation, community-based case finding, social inclusion
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Project Officer, District Coordinator, Physiotherapist (Disability Prevention), M&E/Monitoring Officer, Field Supervisor
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: High-burden states (e.g. Bihar, Odisha, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, etc.)

name: IPE Global
description: IPE Global implements large-scale public health and development programmes funded by national/state governments, USAID, FCDO, World Bank, etc. Work includes improving RMNCH service delivery, urban health systems, health financing reforms, SBCC, quality of care, nutrition, and last-mile delivery of government schemes. They recruit programme managers, technical specialists, monitoring & evaluation leads, data and analytics officers, district/state coordinators, and health financing/policy consultants.

extraInfo.Category: Development consulting & implementation partner (for government and donors)
extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: RMNCH+A, health systems strengthening, urban health, health financing, nutrition, social protection delivery, SBCC
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Technical Specialist (RMNCH / Health Systems), State Coordinator, M&E Lead, Programme Manager, Health Financing/Policy Consultant
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: Pan-India (often embedded in State NHM / Dept. of Health offices)

name: India Health Action Trust (IHAT)
description: IHAT implements Technical Support Units in partnership with high-burden state governments (notably Uttar Pradesh). It supports maternal and newborn health, family planning, HIV prevention among key populations, and TB systems strengthening. IHAT staff sit inside health departments and work on supervision, data review, training, logistics, and programme quality. This is one of the most common real-world implementation employers for public health professionals at state and district level.

extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: Maternal and newborn health, RMNCH, HIV prevention, TB systems strengthening, data-driven public health management
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: District Public Health Consultant, M&E Officer, Programme Manager, State Technical Specialist (RMNCH/HIV/TB), Training/Capacity Building Lead
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: Uttar Pradesh and other high-priority geographies

name: CARE India
description: CARE India partners with state health and ICDS systems to improve facility- and community-level RMNCH+N outcomes. Work includes facility mentoring for labour room quality, home visits for newborn care, SAM management, adolescent anaemia programmes, and technical support for large-scale nutrition missions. They recruit block and district technical officers, training coordinators, programme managers, and monitoring & evaluation specialists, often embedded in state structures.

extraInfo.Category: Large development NGO aligned with state governments
extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: Maternal & newborn survival, severe acute malnutrition, adolescent anaemia, frontline worker mentoring, community-based nutrition
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Block Technical Officer (Health/Nutrition), District Coordinator, Training Coordinator, Programme Manager, M&E Specialist
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Odisha, Jharkhand, etc.

name: Population Services International (PSI) / PSI India (sometimes under local affiliates)
description: PSI applies market-based and private-sector models to expand access to SRH, condoms and contraceptives, STI/HIV prevention, self-care services, and quality-assured private primary care in urban settings. Implementation work includes provider network strengthening, demand generation/SBCC, community outreach for key populations, and linkage to services. PSI hires programme leads, state coordinators, demand generation/SBCC specialists, provider network managers, and M&E staff.

extraInfo.Category: Social marketing and health systems NGO
extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: Sexual and reproductive health, HIV prevention for key populations, self-care, urban primary care networks, private sector engagement
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Programme Manager, State Coordinator, SBCC / Demand Generation Specialist, Network Manager (Private Providers), M&E/Strategic Information Officer
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: Urban/peri-urban hubs in multiple states, often under donor-funded SRH/HIV projects

name: Clinton Health Access Initiative (CHAI) – India country team
description: CHAI partners with governments to improve access to affordable, high-quality diagnostics, medicines, oxygen systems, and service delivery in TB, HIV, hepatitis, RMNCH, and other priority areas. In India, CHAI staff frequently sit with state or national programme leads to drive implementation: supply chain optimization, private sector engagement for TB, maternal/newborn health strengthening, and oxygen ecosystem scale-up. Roles are technical but operational.

extraInfo.Category: International NGO / Health systems and access to commodities
extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: TB, HIV, hepatitis, oxygen systems, RMNCH, diagnostics access, health systems market shaping
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Programme Officer, State Programme Manager, Supply Chain/Market Access Associate, Technical Advisor (TB/RMNCH/Oxygen), Data & M&E Associate
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: Delhi + multiple state postings

name: PATH India
description: PATH works directly with national and state governments, manufacturers, and providers to introduce and scale health technologies and delivery models. In India this includes TB molecular diagnostics rollout, oxygen generation and biomedical maintenance systems, immunization cold chain and last-mile delivery, digital health platforms for primary care, and NCD screening models. PATH recruits programme managers, state technical officers, biomedical/oxygen systems coordinators, and digital health implementation leads who are embedded with government counterparts.

extraInfo.Category: Global health implementation and innovation nonprofit (India country office)
extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: TB diagnostics scale-up, oxygen ecosystems, immunization/cold chain, primary care digital tools, NCD screening models
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Programme Manager, State Technical Officer, Biomedical/Oxygen Systems Coordinator, Digital Health Implementation Lead, M&E/Analytics Officer
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: Multiple states + national technical support to MoHFW/ICMR

name: JSI (John Snow, Inc.) / JSI India projects
description: JSI supports Indian governments on last-mile delivery systems: routine immunization strengthening, vaccine cold chain and logistics, essential medicines supply chains, digital tools for inventory and reporting, and primary health care/urban health systems models. They recruit supply chain officers, immunization technical officers, state coordinators, M&E specialists, and digital health system implementers who work closely with state NHM and immunization cells.

extraInfo.Category: Public health systems and supply chain implementation partner
extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: Routine immunization, vaccine logistics, essential medicines supply chain, PHC/urban health systems, community health worker support
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Immunization Technical Officer, Supply Chain Specialist, State Coordinator, M&E Specialist, Digital Health/Logistics Officer
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: State and district postings in high-priority geographies, plus Delhi technical backstopping

name: FHI 360 (India / Asia programs)
description: FHI 360 supports HIV and TB prevention and treatment among key populations, SRH and family planning, lab systems strengthening, and behaviour change communication. In India and South Asia, FHI 360 implements targeted interventions for high-risk groups, builds state capacity, and strengthens surveillance/reporting systems. They hire technical advisors, M&E/strategic information officers, state/district programme managers, and lab/quality systems coordinators.

extraInfo.Category: International NGO / Global health and development implementer
extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: HIV prevention and care, TB, key populations, SRH/FP, SBC, lab systems, health systems strengthening
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Technical Advisor (HIV/TB/SRH), Strategic Information/M&E Officer, Programme Manager (Key Populations), Lab Systems/Quality Coordinator
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: Delhi and state-level placements on donor-funded programmes

name: Voluntary Health Association networks / State-level VHAs (e.g. VHAI)
description: Voluntary Health Association networks work with state governments and civil society on tobacco control enforcement, public health entitlements awareness, NCD prevention, and health equity advocacy. They implement awareness campaigns, capacity-building of frontline workers, and policy advocacy at state level. They recruit programme officers, state coordinators, advocacy and communication officers, and M&E staff to support implementation and policy interface.

extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: Tobacco control, NCD prevention, community health worker support, health rights and entitlements access
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Programme Officer, State Coordinator, Advocacy & Communications Officer, M&E/Documentation Officer
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: Multiple states via VHA chapters

name: WaterAid India
description: WaterAid India works with state governments and local bodies to strengthen access to safe water, sanitation, and hygiene. Programmes include menstrual hygiene management, hygiene behaviour change in communities and schools, strengthening WASH in health facilities, and urban sanitation/fecal sludge management. They recruit state programme managers, WASH specialists, behaviour change/IEC leads, and M&E/knowledge management staff tied to government programmes.

extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: Rural and urban sanitation, hygiene behaviour change, WASH in health facilities and schools, faecal sludge management
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: State Programme Manager, WASH Specialist, Behaviour Change/IEC Lead, Monitoring & Evaluation Officer
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: Multiple high-focus states, urban local bodies, aspirational districts

name: World Vision India / World Vision International (India programmes)
description: World Vision runs child health and nutrition programmes, adolescent girls’ anaemia reduction, school WASH, livelihood and cash support for vulnerable families, and humanitarian relief in emergencies. Teams operate at block/district/community level and coordinate with ICDS, Health, and local administration. They recruit programme managers, district coordinators, nutrition officers, M&E staff, and emergency response/rapid deployment personnel.

extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: Child health and nutrition, WASH, adolescent girls’ anaemia, livelihoods, humanitarian response
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Programme Manager (Health/Nutrition), District Coordinator, Nutrition Officer, M&E Officer, Humanitarian Response Officer
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: Multiple states, including high-vulnerability districts and humanitarian settings

name: International Rescue Committee (IRC) – India / South Asia technical presence
description: IRC delivers humanitarian health programming in acute crisis and displacement settings globally, and in South Asia works on health systems for refugees/asylum seekers, GBV response systems, WASH in emergencies, and SRH in crisis settings. They hire health coordinators, GBV and protection specialists, SRH in emergencies advisors, WASH engineers, programme managers, and M&E/Grants/Partnerships staff for implementation and systems support to governments and local partners.

extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: Humanitarian health, emergency SRH, GBV response systems, cash/basic needs, WASH in crisis and displacement settings
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Health Coordinator, GBV Specialist, SRH-in-Emergencies Advisor, WASH Engineer, Programme Manager, M&E/Grants Officer
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: Regional (South Asia including India presence, emergency and migration contexts)

name: SEWA-related Health / Worker Welfare and Occupational Health Initiatives (Self-Employed Women’s Association ecosystem)
description: SEWA-linked health programmes work at the intersection of labour rights, women’s health, and social protection. Teams help women in the informal sector access primary care, maternal health services, NCD care, insurance, and social protection benefits, while also addressing occupational/ergonomic and heat stress risks. They recruit programme coordinators, health educators, community organisers, and public health monitoring staff.

extraInfo.Category: Worker rights / community health NGO network
extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: Women's occupational health, social protection enrollment, primary care linkages for informal workers, NCD and maternal health among self-employed women
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Programme Coordinator, Community Health Organizer, Health Educator, Monitoring & Documentation Officer
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: Primarily Gujarat and other states where SEWA federations are active

name: SEARCH (Society for Education, Action and Research in Community Health)
description: SEARCH in Gadchiroli runs direct service delivery to tribal and remote rural communities, including community health workers for maternal/newborn survival, management of neonatal sepsis, NCD screening and follow-up, alcohol harm reduction, and mental health care models tailored to tribal populations. Staff spend time in villages, coordinating care pathways between community and the formal health system.

extraInfo.Category: Rural tribal health NGO implementing service delivery models
extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: Tribal health, maternal and newborn survival, community health workers, mental health, alcohol harm reduction, NCDs in underserved areas
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Public Health Physician, Programme Coordinator, Field Supervisor, Community Health Worker Mentor, Monitoring & Evaluation Officer
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: Gadchiroli, Maharashtra (tribal/remote blocks)

name: Catholic Health Association of India (CHAI)
description: CHAI is a large network of not-for-profit hospitals and health centres, especially in underserved and tribal geographies. It supports TB and HIV programmes, NCD screening, palliative care, access to essential medicines, community outreach, and health worker training. Implementation roles often involve coordination with district health authorities and faith-based facilities to expand service delivery in hard-to-reach locations.

extraInfo.Programmatic Focus / Thematic Areas: Primary health care in underserved areas, TB, HIV, NCD screening, palliative care, health access for remote/tribal communities
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: State/District Programme Coordinator, TB/HIV Programme Manager, Training & Capacity Building Officer, M&E Officer, Community Outreach Coordinator
extraInfo.Geographic Footprint / Deployment: Pan-India network with emphasis on underserved & tribal areas

name: Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) Headquarters
description: ICMR is India’s apex body for biomedical and public health research under MoHFW. It oversees disease surveillance, operational research for national programmes (TB, vector-borne disease control, immunization), outbreak investigation, multi-centre studies, national registries, guideline development, and funding of extramural research and fellowships.

extraInfo.Category: Central government apex biomedical & public health research body
extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Epidemiology, infectious diseases, NCDs, surveillance, health systems, implementation research, public health policy
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Scientist B/C/D, Project Scientist, Research Assistant, Statistician, Project Technical Officer
extraInfo.Location / Presence: New Delhi HQ + oversight of all ICMR institutes

name: ICMR - National Institute of Epidemiology (NIE)
description: ICMR-NIE in Chennai focuses on applied epidemiology and implementation research to strengthen public health programmes and surveillance. It leads the Field Epidemiology Training Programme (FETP), supports outbreak investigations, TB and vector-borne disease research, and NCD risk factor surveillance.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Field epidemiology, surveillance, outbreak investigation, operational research, implementation science
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Project Scientist, Consultant (Epidemiology), Biostatistician, Research Assistant, FETP Mentor

name: ICMR - National Institute for Research in Tuberculosis (NIRT)
description: ICMR-NIRT in Chennai is India’s flagship TB research institute, supporting NTEP with clinical trials, drug resistance surveillance, and operational research for diagnosis, adherence, newer regimens, and DR-TB care. It manages multi-state field implementation studies.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: TB, MDR/XDR-TB, TB diagnostics, drug resistance, operational research for NTEP
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Project Technical Officer, Scientist B (Medical / Non-medical), Field Investigator, Data Manager

name: ICMR - National AIDS Research Institute (NARI)
description: ICMR-NARI in Pune leads India’s HIV research agenda, including epidemiology, prevention trials, ART optimization, PrEP, stigma reduction, and linkage-to-care models for key populations. It supports NACO with surveillance and programme evaluation.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: HIV, STIs, key populations, PrEP, stigma, linkage to care
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Project Scientist, Programme Coordinator, Counsellor, M&E Officer, Field Investigator

name: ICMR - National Institute of Malaria Research (NIMR)
description: ICMR-NIMR studies malaria transmission dynamics, vector control, insecticide resistance, climate drivers, and surveillance in endemic zones. It generates evidence for malaria elimination policy and supports NVBDCP.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Malaria epidemiology, vector biology, insecticide resistance, surveillance, elimination strategies
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Research Scientist, Entomologist, Project Assistant, Data Analyst, Field Worker
extraInfo.Location / Presence: New Delhi HQ + field stations in endemic states

name: ICMR - National Institute of Cholera and Enteric Diseases (NICED)
description: ICMR-NICED in Kolkata works on cholera, typhoid, AMR, environmental and wastewater surveillance, and vaccine evaluation for enteric infections. It supports outbreak response and WASH-linked public health action in urban and peri-urban slums.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Diarrhoeal diseases, AMR in enteric pathogens, WASH-linked outbreaks, vaccine trials
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Scientist B/C, Project Research Assistant, Lab Technician, Data Manager, Field Investigator

name: ICMR - National Institute for Research in Environmental Health (NIREH)
description: ICMR-NIREH in Bhopal studies environmental exposure, industrial contamination, ambient and indoor air pollution, occupational hazards, and long-term health impacts of disasters. It informs national environmental health policy.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Environmental/occupational health, air pollution, toxic exposure, climate and health
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Scientist B (Environmental Health), Project Assistant, Technician, Research Associate

name: ICMR - National Institute of Nutrition (NIN)
description: ICMR-NIN in Hyderabad develops national dietary standards, studies undernutrition and anaemia, evaluates fortification, and supports nutrition missions such as POSHAN Abhiyaan and Anemia Mukt Bharat.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Maternal/child nutrition, micronutrient deficiency, anaemia, fortification, dietary guidelines
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Scientist B (Nutrition), Project Nutritionist, Statistician, Field Investigator

name: ICMR - National Institute for Research in Reproductive and Child Health (NIRRCH)
description: ICMR-NIRRCH in Mumbai works on RMNCH+A, respectful maternity care, contraception, adolescent anaemia, infertility, and newborn survival. It supports MoHFW on reproductive and child health policy and programme design.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health; fertility; family planning
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Project Scientist, Programme Officer (RMNCH), Social Scientist, Statistician, Field Investigator

name: ICMR - National Institute of Virology (NIV)
description: ICMR-NIV in Pune leads viral outbreak detection, genomic surveillance, vaccine evaluation, biosafety containment work, and national lab network strengthening for pandemic preparedness.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Emerging/re-emerging viruses, genomic surveillance, zoonoses, outbreak response, BSL-3/4 virology
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Scientist B/C (Virology/Microbiology), Project Research Associate, Lab Technician, Data Analyst, Field Coordinator

name: ICMR - Regional Medical Research Centres (RMRCs) network
description: ICMR RMRC sites (e.g. RMRC Bhubaneswar, RMRC NE Region Shillong, RMRC Port Blair, RMRC Gorakhpur) focus on tribal/rural health, JE/AE surveillance, malaria, dengue, One Health surveillance, nutrition, and district health systems gaps for hard-to-reach populations.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Tribal health, vector-borne diseases, zoonoses, nutrition, rural health systems in underserved geographies
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Project Assistant, Scientist B (Non-medical), Field Investigator, Data Entry Operator
extraInfo.Location / Presence: Odisha, Northeast, Andaman & Nicobar, Uttar Pradesh, etc.

name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) New Delhi
description: AIIMS Delhi conducts large-scale public health, systems, and community-based research through the Centre for Community Medicine (CCM) and other departments. Focus areas include PHC service delivery, NCDs, nutrition, injury prevention, and environmental/occupational exposures.

extraInfo.Category: Institute of National Importance / Central academic medical & public health research centre
extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Community medicine, primary care systems, NCD risk factors, environmental/occupational health, implementation research
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Senior Research Fellow, Project Scientist, Biostatistician, Project Technician, Field Investigator
extraInfo.Location / Presence: New Delhi + Delhi NCR and partner states

name: AIIMS Bhopal / AIIMS Jodhpur / AIIMS Bhubaneswar / AIIMS Rishikesh / AIIMS Raipur / AIIMS Patna etc.
description: Newer AIIMS institutes lead regionally relevant implementation research: population NCD screening through HWCs, maternal and child health quality, infectious disease surveillance, road safety, and tribal/occupational health. They recruit project staff for state and NHM-linked studies.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Community & family medicine, infectious disease surveillance, NCD screening, occupational/tribal health, trauma/injury systems
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Research Associate, Project Coordinator, Field Investigator, Statistician, Data Manager
extraInfo.Location / Presence: Multiple states (MP, Rajasthan, Odisha, Uttarakhand, Chhattisgarh, Bihar, etc.)

name: National Institute of Health and Family Welfare (NIHFW)
description: NIHFW in New Delhi provides capacity building and health systems policy/monitoring support to MoHFW. Work includes NHM programme monitoring, reproductive and child health, HMIS strengthening, human resources for health, and quality of care systems.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Public health management, RMNCH, HMIS, health policy support, programme monitoring
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Consultant (Public Health), M&E Specialist, Training Consultant, Data Analyst

name: National Health Systems Resource Centre (NHSRC)
description: NHSRC supports the National Health Mission and states on health systems design, PHC transformation (AB-HWC), quality standards, community processes, planning and budgeting, and workforce strategy. It is one of the most consistent recruiters of MPH / MD-Community Medicine profiles in India.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Health systems strengthening, primary health care, quality of care, health financing, HRH planning
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Consultant (Public Health Planning), Senior Consultant - Quality Improvement, Community Processes Specialist, Health Financing Analyst

name: State Health Systems Resource Centres / State Programme Management Units (SPMUs)
description: SHSRC / SPMU / TSU-type units in most states function as embedded health systems support cells under NHM. They handle programme planning, monitoring, quality improvement, analytics, and supportive supervision at state and district level for RMNCH, NCD screening, and health systems strengthening.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Public health programme management, RMNCH, NCDs, quality of care, data systems, community processes
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: District Programme Manager, Public Health Consultant, M&E Officer, Quality of Care Lead, Epidemiologist

name: National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) / IDSP
description: NCDC in Delhi anchors the Integrated Disease Surveillance Programme (IDSP), national epidemic intelligence, AMR surveillance, and zoonotic disease coordination. It deploys epidemiologists and data managers to national/state surveillance units and supports rapid outbreak investigation.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Surveillance, outbreak response, AMR, zoonoses, field epidemiology
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Epidemiologist (IDSP), Microbiologist, State Surveillance Officer, Data Manager, Entomologist

name: National Health Mission (NHM) / State NHMs
description: NHM at state and district level runs large-scale public health programmes: maternal and child health, communicable and non-communicable diseases, HWCs, community processes, quality of care, and monitoring & evaluation. Many positions are contractual but continuously available.

extraInfo.Category: Government health programme structures at state level
extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: RMNCH, NCDs, health systems, community processes, programme monitoring
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: District/State Programme Manager, Epidemiologist, Data/MIS Officer, Quality of Care Consultant, Community Process Coordinator

name: Public Health Foundation of India (PHFI) / IIPH Network
description: PHFI and the Indian Institutes of Public Health conduct epidemiological studies, state health systems assessments, tobacco control, NCD surveillance, policy analysis, urban health, and training of the public health workforce. They are major recruiters of Research Assistants/Associates, Biostatisticians, Programme Managers, and Faculty.

extraInfo.Category: Public health academic & research institution (public-private; NGO trust model)
extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Health systems, NCDs, RMNCH, health economics, tobacco control, environmental health, policy research
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Research Assistant, Research Scientist, Programme Manager, Biostatistician, Assistant/Associate Professor
extraInfo.Location / Presence: Delhi NCR, Gandhinagar, Hyderabad, Bhubaneswar, Shillong etc.

name: IIHMR University (Indian Institute of Health Management Research)
description: IIHMR focuses on health systems, public health management, health financing, MIS/HMIS, and evaluation of large national and donor-funded programmes (RMNCH, NCDs, insurance, etc.). It also supports health policy advisory work to governments.

extraInfo.Category: Deemed university / Health management & public health research institute
extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Health systems management, health economics, health financing, HMIS, programme evaluation
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Research Officer, Project Manager, Assistant Professor, M&E Specialist, Consultant (Health Systems)

name: Institute of Public Health (IPH) Bangalore
description: IPH Bangalore conducts applied health systems and implementation research, focusing on strengthening PHC, managing NCDs in primary care, tobacco control policy, and capacity building for health governance and research methods with state governments.

extraInfo.Category: Independent public health research NGO / academic collaborative institute
extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Primary health care, health systems governance, NCD control, tobacco control, implementation research
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Research Officer, Programme Officer, Field Investigator, Qualitative Researcher

name: The George Institute for Global Health – India
description: The George Institute runs research on cardiovascular disease, hypertension control in PHC, trauma and road safety, digital health tools for low-resource settings, and gender and health equity. It also supports policy translation with governments.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: NCDs (hypertension, CVD), injury prevention, primary care models, digital health, road safety, health policy
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Research Fellow, Project Coordinator, Data Manager, Policy & Advocacy Officer, Biostatistician

name: The INCLEN Trust International (INCLEN)
description: INCLEN conducts large multi-site epidemiological and implementation studies on vaccines, nutrition, RMNCH, early childhood development, infectious diseases, and health technology assessment for government decision-making.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Child health, vaccines, RMNCH, nutrition, disease burden, HTA
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Epidemiologist, Biostatistician, Project Manager, Field Supervisor, Qualitative Researcher

name: Tata Institute of Social Sciences (TISS) – School of Health Systems Studies
description: TISS works on health systems and policy research, public health financing, social determinants, urban health, mental health systems, labour and occupational health, and gender equity in health. It partners with governments and donors for evaluations and technical support.

extraInfo.Category: Central (deemed) university / Public health and health systems research school
extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Health policy, health systems governance, social determinants, health financing, urban health, gender and health equity
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Research Associate, Programme Officer, Faculty (Assistant Professor), Public Health Analyst, M&E Officer

name: National Institute of Mental Health and Neuro Sciences (NIMHANS) – Public Health / Epidemiology / Mental Health Policy Units
description: NIMHANS leads public mental health implementation work, including district mental health programmes, suicide prevention systems, de-addiction, school mental health, and policy support to states and MoHFW. Many roles are programme and field-facing.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Mental health systems, addiction, suicide prevention, community mental health, digital mental health, policy
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Project Officer, Field Investigator, Programme Coordinator, Research Assistant, Data Manager

name: St. John’s Medical College & St. John’s Research Institute (SJRI)
description: SJRI runs high-quality research on maternal and child nutrition, low birth weight, infectious diseases, vaccine studies, and community health systems in collaboration with ICMR, DBT, and international funders. Strong field research presence.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Maternal/child nutrition, infectious disease, community health, clinical epidemiology
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Research Assistant, Nutritionist, Field Supervisor, Data Manager, Scientist B

name: Christian Medical College (CMC) Vellore – RUHSA / CHAD / Community Health
description: CMC Vellore’s community health units (RUHSA, CHAD) and ID programmes lead long-term rural and peri-urban public health research covering maternal and child health, infectious disease surveillance, occupational health, NCD screening, and primary care delivery models.

extraInfo.Category: Private deemed university medical college (strong rural public health research model)
extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Rural health systems, infectious diseases, RMNCH, occupational health, NCD screening, palliative and community care
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Research Officer, Programme Manager, Field Investigator, Data Coordinator, Medical Officer (Public Health)
extraInfo.Location / Presence: Vellore district field practice areas, Tamil Nadu

name: Manipal Academy of Higher Education (MAHE) / Dept. of Public Health / KMC Manipal
description: Manipal drives infectious disease and health systems work through its Department of Public Health and Kasturba Medical College, with focus on AMR surveillance, hospital IPC, zoonoses, coastal disaster health, and digital surveillance systems.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Infectious disease epidemiology, AMR, One Health, hospital infection control, disaster health, health policy
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Research Fellow, Epidemiologist, Project Coordinator, Data Analyst, Field Investigator
extraInfo.Location / Presence: Manipal / Udupi, Karnataka; coastal Karnataka field sites

name: SRM Institute of Science and Technology / SRM Medical College Hospital & Research Centre – Dept. of Community Medicine / Public Health
description: SRM conducts implementation research on NCD screening, maternal and child health, adolescent anaemia, school health, and environmental/occupational exposure around industrial belts. It also supports state NHM evaluations.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Community-based NCD screening, RMNCH, adolescent health, environmental/occupational exposure in peri-urban areas
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Project Coordinator, Research Assistant, Statistician, Field Investigator
extraInfo.Location / Presence: Kattankulathur, Tamil Nadu + surrounding field practice areas

name: JIPMER – Dept. of Preventive & Social Medicine / Public Health Units
description: JIPMER in Puducherry runs strong community and public health research through Preventive & Social Medicine and vector control collaborations: dengue/chikungunya surveillance, RMNCH, disaster/heat preparedness, injury/road safety, and coastal community health.

extraInfo.Category: Institute of National Importance (Central govt tertiary care & research institute)
extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Vector-borne disease surveillance, maternal and child health, coastal/rural health systems, injury, disaster/heat preparedness
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Research Associate, Field Investigator, Entomology Assistant, Data Manager, Project Officer (Public Health)
extraInfo.Location / Presence: Puducherry + TN coastal belt field sites

name: PGIMER Chandigarh – School of Public Health / Dept. of Community Medicine
description: PGIMER’s School of Public Health and Community Medicine department run implementation research supporting Punjab, Haryana, Himachal, and national programmes on RMNCH, road safety, air pollution, infectious disease surveillance, and NHM evaluations.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Health systems, RMNCH, NCDs, injury prevention, air pollution & health, programme evaluation
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Research Assistant, Statistician, Field Investigator, Programme Manager, Consultant (Public Health)

name: SCTIMST – Achutha Menon Centre for Health Science Studies (AMCHSS)
description: AMCHSS at Sree Chitra Tirunal Institute (Trivandrum) is one of India’s earliest public health and health policy training centres. It focuses on NCDs, health economics, primary care models, health equity, and health technology assessment for policy.

extraInfo.Category: Institute of National Importance (Dept. of S&T, Govt. of India) – public health school
extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Health policy & systems research, NCDs, health economics, HTA, PHC models
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Research Associate, Research Fellow, Biostatistician, Project Coordinator, Assistant Professor (Public Health / Health Policy)

name: Banaras Hindu University (BHU) – Institute of Medical Sciences / Dept. of Community Medicine
description: BHU (Varanasi) conducts implementation and cohort studies on RMNCH, nutrition, vector-borne disease control, and environmental exposures in eastern Uttar Pradesh and the adjoining Bihar belt. Strong rural/low-resource service delivery focus.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Maternal and child health, nutrition, vector-borne disease, environmental health, rural health service delivery
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Research Assistant, Field Worker, Programme Coordinator, Epidemiologist, Data Manager
extraInfo.Location / Presence: Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh + eastern UP field sites

name: MGIMS Sevagram (Mahatma Gandhi Institute of Medical Sciences) – Dept. of Community Medicine
description: MGIMS Sevagram (Wardha) is known for long-term rural field practice areas and innovative village-based service delivery models. Work includes maternal/newborn survival, surveillance, NCD screening, and evaluation of public schemes in rural/tribal Vidarbha.

extraInfo.Category: Trust-based medical college with rural public health research model
extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Rural health systems, maternal/newborn health, village surveillance, chronic disease care in rural/tribal settings
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Field Investigator, Programme Officer, Research Assistant, Data Manager, Community Health Worker (Project)

name: SEARCH (Society for Education, Action and Research in Community Health) Gadchiroli
description: SEARCH, founded by Dr. Abhay Bang and Dr. Rani Bang, pioneered community-based newborn care in tribal/rural Gadchiroli and now works on NCDs, mental health, gender, alcohol harm reduction, and health system accountability for excluded populations.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Tribal and rural health, maternal/newborn survival, NCDs in underserved populations, mental health, alcohol harm reduction
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Programme Coordinator, Public Health Physician, Statistician, Field Investigator, Research Associate

name: India HIV/AIDS Alliance (Alliance India)
description: Alliance India supports targeted interventions for key populations, harm reduction for PWID, stigma reduction, ART adherence, and community-driven monitoring. It partners with NACO, state SACS, and CBOs, and runs high-intensity monitoring & evaluation systems.

extraInfo.Category: National NGO with technical support role to NACO/State AIDS Control Societies
extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: HIV prevention, key populations, harm reduction, stigma reduction, community systems strengthening
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Programme Officer, M&E Officer, State Programme Manager, Advocacy Officer, Community Liaison Coordinator

name: India Health Action Trust (IHAT)
description: IHAT runs Technical Support Units embedded in high-priority states (notably Uttar Pradesh), supporting RMNCH, HIV prevention, TB, and systems strengthening including data, supervision, training, and logistics. It is one of the most consistent recruiters for district/state public health consultant roles.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Maternal and newborn health, RMNCH, HIV, TB, state health systems strengthening
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: District Public Health Consultant, M&E Officer, Programme Manager, State Technical Specialist (RMNCH/HIV/TB)

name: CARE India (technical and knowledge management units)
description: CARE India implements and supports state-led RMNCH and nutrition programmes, with embedded technical teams for maternal/newborn survival, SAM management, adolescent anaemia, frontline worker capacity-building, and programme quality in high-burden states.

extraInfo.Category: Large development NGO aligned with public health and nutrition systems
extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Maternal and child health, nutrition, severe acute malnutrition, frontline worker mentoring, social protection delivery
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Block Technical Officer (Health/Nutrition), M&E Specialist, Training Coordinator, Knowledge Management Officer
extraInfo.Location / Presence: Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, MP, Odisha etc.

name: CHRD-SAS (Centre for Health Research and Development, Society for Applied Studies)
description: Society for Applied Studies / CHRD runs high-quality community trials and large implementation research on immunization, nutrition, maternal/newborn survival, and primary health care delivery in North India. It often partners with state governments and global funders.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Maternal, newborn, and child health; nutrition; vaccines; community trials; primary care delivery models
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Research Officer, Trial Coordinator, Field Supervisor, Data Manager, Medical Officer (Public Health)
extraInfo.Location / Presence: New Delhi / NCR + Uttar Pradesh / Bihar field sites

name: The Energy and Resources Institute (TERI) – Environment & Health Division
description: TERI links environment and public health through work on air pollution exposure, household/ambient air quality, climate risk, occupational hazards, and health-informed urban resilience planning. Increasingly relevant for heat action plans and clean air policies.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Air pollution and health, climate & health adaptation, occupational/environmental exposure, urban resilience
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Environmental Health Researcher, Air Quality Analyst, Programme Manager (Climate & Health), Epidemiologist

name: PHFI Tobacco Control / HRIDAY / Bloomberg Initiative partners (Delhi tobacco control consortia)
description: Delhi-based consortia including PHFI tobacco control units and HRIDAY provide technical support on tobacco taxation and regulation, enforcement support, surveillance of use (especially youth), and NCD policy advocacy for governments.

extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Tobacco control policy, taxation, regulation of marketing, NCD prevention, adolescent health
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Policy Researcher, M&E Specialist, Advocacy & Communications Officer, Data Analyst
extraInfo.Location / Presence: New Delhi + state tobacco control cells

name: Population & Health Surveillance / HDSS sites (e.g. Ballabgarh/AIIMS, Vellore, Anantapur etc.)
description: Long-standing Health and Demographic Surveillance System (HDSS) sites in India (Ballabgarh AIIMS, Vellore, Anantapur, etc.) maintain longitudinal population cohorts and verbal autopsy systems for mortality, NCD risk, maternal/child outcomes, and service utilization. They underpin implementation research and health systems monitoring.

extraInfo.Category: Population health and demographic surveillance sites (academic-government partnerships)
extraInfo.Specializations / Focus Areas: Vital events surveillance, maternal/child health, injury, NCD risk factors, programme coverage monitoring
extraInfo.Typical Recruitment Cadres: Field Surveyor, Data Manager, Statistician, Project Coordinator, Research Fellow (Epidemiology)
extraInfo.Location / Presence: Multiple long-term field sites across states

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
description: WHO is the United Nations’ specialized health agency. It provides global leadership on public health standards, surveillance, outbreak control, health systems strengthening, and regulatory guidance. In India, WHO works closely with the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, state governments, and partners to support disease elimination (TB, polio, malaria), epidemiological surveillance, digital health, primary care, and Universal Health Coverage. WHO also deploys consultants, field monitors, epidemiologists, data managers, lab specialists, and program managers to drive national and subnational public health programmes.

extraInfo.Specializations: Health systems, infectious diseases, immunization, UHC, emergency response

name: United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF)
description: UNICEF supports governments to improve survival, development, and protection of children and adolescents. Work includes newborn and child health, vaccination campaigns, micronutrient supplementation, WASH in schools and health facilities, early childhood development, social protection, gender equity, and adolescent mental health. UNICEF India recruits for programme management, monitoring & evaluation, nutrition, immunization, water and sanitation, health systems, communication for behaviour change, and emergency preparedness roles at national and state levels.

extraInfo.Specializations: Child health, nutrition, WASH, immunization, RMNCH+A, SBC

name: United Nations Development Programme (UNDP)
description: UNDP works on inclusive development, governance, climate resilience, health systems strengthening, and SDG acceleration. In health, UNDP supports large-scale procurement and supply chain management for HIV, TB, malaria, NCDs, and diagnostics; digital health governance; health financing; and social protection. In India, UNDP manages public health projects including health supply chain optimization, digital health platforms, TB elimination acceleration, and migrant/social protection programmes. They frequently recruit public health professionals, public policy analysts, data managers, and supply chain specialists.

extraInfo.Specializations: Health systems, HIV, TB, procurement & supply chain, governance

name: World Bank Group
description: The World Bank funds and provides technical assistance for large-scale health, nutrition, and sanitation programmes. Focus areas include primary health care reform, health financing, pandemic preparedness, social protection, women’s and child nutrition, and health system resilience. In India, World Bank operations include state-level health systems strengthening, health insurance reforms, nutrition missions, and pandemic preparedness loans. Public health hires include health economists, monitoring & evaluation specialists, operations officers, and health systems consultants.

extraInfo.Specializations: Health financing, health economics, primary care systems, nutrition, water & sanitation

name: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria
description: The Global Fund is a financing mechanism that supports countries to prevent, diagnose, and treat HIV, TB, and malaria, and to build resilient, sustainable health systems. India is both a recipient and a strategic partner. The Global Fund funds national and state programmes, procurement systems, labs, digital surveillance, key population outreach, and community systems strengthening. Roles are available in grant management, monitoring & evaluation, epidemiology, health products management, and resilient & sustainable systems for health (RSSH).

extraInfo.Specializations: HIV, TB, malaria, health systems strengthening, supply chain, data systems

name: Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance
description: Gavi finances and supports equitable access to vaccines in lower-income settings. It works on new vaccine introductions, cold chain and logistics, last-mile delivery, surveillance for vaccine-preventable diseases, and strengthening primary health care. Although India is now largely domestically financed, India is a strategic manufacturing and innovation hub, and Gavi partners with Indian national and state governments, CSOs, and vaccine manufacturers. Professionals are recruited in immunization, supply chain, market shaping, impact evaluation, and programme management.

extraInfo.Specializations: Immunization policy, vaccine delivery, cold chain, health systems strengthening

name: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
description: CDC supports partner countries through technical assistance on surveillance, field epidemiology training (FETP), outbreak investigation, AMR containment, emergency preparedness, HIV and TB control, and lab network strengthening. CDC India works with national programmes such as NTEP, National Centre for Disease Control, and ICMR institutions. They recruit epidemiologists, surveillance officers, lab advisors, AMR specialists, data scientists, and programme managers through US Embassy/CDC India postings and US government hiring mechanisms.

extraInfo.Category: US government public health agency (international programs)
extraInfo.Specializations: Epidemiology, surveillance, laboratory systems, outbreak response, anti-microbial resistance

name: U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID)
description: USAID funds and implements global health and development programmes, including TB elimination, RMNCH, urban health, health financing reforms, health private sector engagement, WASH, and infectious disease preparedness. USAID India partners with government ministries, civil society, and private sector innovators to improve service delivery and health outcomes. They recruit for health advisors, monitoring & evaluation specialists, private sector engagement experts, and TB/urban health technical leads, often via implementing partners.

extraInfo.Specializations: Health systems, RMNCH, TB, HIV, private sector engagement, health financing

name: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)
description: FAO works on global food security, sustainable agriculture, animal health, and safe food systems. In India, FAO engages in disease surveillance for zoonotic infections, One Health AMR containment, food safety standards, climate-resilient agriculture, and nutrition-sensitive agriculture to reduce stunting and micronutrient deficiencies. FAO hires veterinarians, One Health specialists, food safety experts, AMR program officers, and monitoring & evaluation specialists for India and South Asia projects.

extraInfo.Specializations: Food safety, zoonoses, antimicrobial resistance in animal health, nutrition security

name: World Food Programme (WFP)
description: WFP is the UN agency focused on hunger and nutrition. In India, WFP supports government-led food safety nets such as the Public Distribution System and ICDS, works on fortified staples, school meals, climate-resilient livelihoods, and logistics/supply chain strengthening for last-mile delivery of entitlements. Public health professionals are recruited in nutrition, social protection systems, micronutrient fortification, programme monitoring, last-mile logistics, and emergency response planning.

extraInfo.Specializations: Nutrition, food security, social protection, logistics, supply chain

name: United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA)
description: UNFPA works to ensure reproductive rights, access to contraception, safe motherhood, adolescent health, and prevention of gender-based violence. In India, UNFPA supports adolescent reproductive and sexual health programmes, family planning logistics management, and gender-transformative programming with governments and civil society. They recruit technical experts in SRH, adolescent health, gender, M&E, and programme management at national and state offices.

extraInfo.Specializations: Sexual and reproductive health, adolescents, gender, family planning

name: Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS (UNAIDS)
description: UNAIDS coordinates the global response to HIV by supporting evidence-based prevention, treatment access, stigma reduction, community-led services, and human rights-based approaches. In India, UNAIDS works with NACO, state AIDS control societies, and community organisations to strengthen prevention among key populations, improve data systems, and align policy with global HIV commitments. UNAIDS recruits strategic information advisors, policy analysts, community engagement specialists, and programme officers.

extraInfo.Specializations: HIV prevention and treatment, key populations, health rights, surveillance

name: Gates Foundation (Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation)
description: The Gates Foundation funds large-scale public health initiatives focused on infectious disease elimination, vaccines, maternal and newborn health, nutrition, sanitation, data systems, and digital public health infrastructure. India is one of its key geographies, including work on TB, routine immunization, health systems digitalization, gender data, and sanitation. They recruit for technical experts in health policy, epidemiology, program strategy, partnerships, and impact evaluation, often based in Delhi or Bengaluru.

extraInfo.Specializations: Infectious diseases, vaccines, health innovation, health systems, sanitation

name: Clinton Health Access Initiative (CHAI)
description: CHAI works with governments to increase access to high-quality treatment, diagnostics, and preventive interventions for high-burden diseases, while strengthening systems such as supply chains, labs, and health financing. CHAI India works on TB case finding, paediatric HIV, access to hepatitis C treatment, maternal and neonatal health, oxygen ecosystems, and cancer screening. They recruit program officers, epidemiologists, health economists, supply chain analysts, and monitoring & evaluation leads.

extraInfo.Specializations: Market shaping, affordable diagnostics and drugs, HIV, TB, malaria, hepatitis, RMNCH

name: Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) / Doctors Without Borders
description: MSF provides independent emergency medical care in crisis zones, including conflict settings, epidemics, natural disasters, and areas with collapsing health systems. In India, MSF has delivered care for drug-resistant TB, HIV, kala-azar, sexual and gender-based violence, and mental health, especially among marginalized populations. They recruit medical officers, infectious disease specialists, counsellors, pharmacists, lab managers, and project coordinators with strong public health orientation.

extraInfo.Specializations: Emergency medicine, outbreaks, AMR, HIV/TB, NCD care in crises

name: Save the Children International
description: Save the Children focuses on survival, learning, and protection of children. In India, work includes newborn and child health, nutrition rehabilitation, severe acute malnutrition management, immunization support, adolescent health, disaster response, child protection systems, and education continuity in humanitarian settings. They recruit programme managers, nutrition specialists, M&E officers, child protection and humanitarian response staff.

extraInfo.Specializations: Child health, nutrition, education in emergencies, protection

name: PATH
description: PATH develops and scales affordable health technologies and delivery models for LMICs. In India, PATH supports TB diagnostics rollout, oxygen systems, vaccine delivery innovation, digital health tools, primary care strengthening for NCDs, and health workforce capacity-building. PATH recruits programme managers, biomedical/diagnostics specialists, public health researchers, market access strategists, and digital health implementation leads.

extraInfo.Category: International NGO / Global health innovation nonprofit
extraInfo.Specializations: Vaccines, diagnostics, digital health, NCDs, primary health care

name: FHI 360
description: FHI 360 is a global nonprofit working on integrated health and development solutions. It focuses on HIV prevention and treatment, TB, family planning, reproductive health, laboratory systems, and social and behavior change communication. In India and South Asia, FHI 360 supports key population programs, HIV prevention innovations, PrEP scale-up, and strategic information systems. They recruit technical advisors, M&E specialists, SBC experts, epidemiologists, and implementation science staff.

extraInfo.Specializations: HIV, TB, reproductive health, social & behavioral change, health systems strengthening

name: Jhpiego (an affiliate of Johns Hopkins University)
description: Jhpiego supports governments to improve quality of maternal, newborn, and reproductive health services by strengthening clinical skills, mentoring, infection prevention, and health systems. Jhpiego India has worked on labour room quality of care, respectful maternity care, cervical cancer screening, family planning counselling, and health worker training at scale under national programmes. They recruit clinical/public health technical officers, RMNCH advisors, training & capacity-building specialists, and implementation managers.

extraInfo.Category: International NGO / Global health technical agency
extraInfo.Specializations: Maternal and newborn health, RMNCH, FP, health workforce strengthening

name: JSI (John Snow, Inc.)
description: JSI focuses on strengthening health systems, especially last-mile delivery of essential health commodities, vaccine logistics, community health worker programmes, digital health tools, and primary health care systems. In India, JSI has supported routine immunization strengthening, essential medicines supply chains, and urban primary health care models. They recruit supply chain experts, digital health architects, monitoring & evaluation specialists, and PHC systems advisors.

extraInfo.Category: International NGO / Public health consulting and implementation partner
extraInfo.Specializations: Supply chain, immunization, PHC systems, digital health, community health

name: CARE International
description: CARE works to fight poverty and social injustice, centering women and girls. CARE India operates large-scale programmes on maternal and newborn survival, severe malnutrition management, frontline worker capacity-building, social protection delivery, and health systems accountability. They recruit programme leads in RMNCH, monitoring & evaluation, nutrition, gender, social protection delivery, and humanitarian response planning.

extraInfo.Category: International NGO / Humanitarian and development organisation
extraInfo.Specializations: Gender equity, nutrition, RMNCH, livelihoods, humanitarian response

name: RTI International
description: RTI International is a nonprofit research and implementation institute. In global health, RTI works on health systems governance, health financing, primary care quality, TB control, HIV, air pollution and health, and WASH in low-resource settings. In India, RTI has supported air quality and health burden assessments, urban health systems work, and TB private sector engagement. They recruit public health researchers, health systems governance specialists, economists, and M&E professionals.

extraInfo.Specializations: Public health research, health systems, NCDs, environmental health, WASH

name: Population Services International (PSI)
description: PSI applies private-sector approaches to expand access to affordable health products and services. In India, PSI and PSI-affiliated organizations have worked on family planning, condoms and contraceptives, HIV prevention for key populations, self-care models, and primary care access through networked private providers. They recruit in programme implementation, demand generation/SBC, marketing, market-shaping, and monitoring & evaluation.

extraInfo.Specializations: Sexual and reproductive health, HIV prevention, self-care, private sector engagement

name: The Union (International Union Against Tuberculosis and Lung Disease)
description: The Union is a global scientific and technical organisation focused on lung health, including TB, MDR/XDR-TB, tobacco control, air pollution, and respiratory health. India has been a major geography for its research, operational pilots, technical assistance to NTEP, and tobacco control advocacy. They recruit TB technical advisors, operational research trainers, epidemiologists, and tobacco control policy specialists.

extraInfo.Specializations: TB, tobacco control, lung health, operational research, MDR-TB

name: FIND (Foundation for Innovative New Diagnostics)
description: FIND accelerates equitable access to high-quality, affordable diagnostics in low- and middle-income countries. In India, FIND has supported rollout and evaluation of rapid molecular tests for TB, linkage-to-care systems, viral hepatitis diagnostics, AMR surveillance, and integrated testing models. They recruit laboratory systems specialists, diagnostics market-shaping experts, epidemiologists, study coordinators, and implementation managers.

extraInfo.Specializations: Diagnostics for TB, HIV, malaria, hepatitis, AMR, pandemic preparedness

name: Vital Strategies
description: Vital Strategies partners with governments to strengthen public health systems and policies in areas like tobacco control, air quality, road safety, overdose prevention, and civil registration and vital statistics (CRVS). In India, they have worked on tobacco control policy enforcement, Bloomberg Initiative support, urban health data systems, and road safety reforms. They recruit policy and advocacy specialists, epidemiologists, data analysts, and communication strategists.

extraInfo.Category: International NGO / Global public health organization
extraInfo.Specializations: Tobacco control, road safety, NCD prevention, data systems

name: International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC)
description: ICRC provides neutral and independent humanitarian protection and assistance in conflict and violence settings. Health work includes emergency medical care, surgical care, rehabilitation, water and sanitation, public health in detention settings, and health systems support where services have collapsed. ICRC has a regional presence in South Asia and hires medical coordinators, water and habitat (WASH) engineers, mental health and psychosocial support specialists, epidemiologists, and health emergency planners.

extraInfo.Specializations: Humanitarian health in conflict, emergency surgery, health in detention, public health in emergencies
