name: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC)
description: The IFRC is the global network of national Red Cross/Red Crescent societies, focused on public health in emergencies, epidemic preparedness, disaster response, first aid capacity, WASH, and community resilience. In India, IFRC works with Indian Red Cross Society on disaster response, blood services, and public health outreach in emergencies such as floods, heatwaves, and outbreaks. They recruit emergency health coordinators, epidemic preparedness officers, WASH specialists, and community health programme managers.

extraInfo.Specializations: Disaster health response, community health, epidemic preparedness, WASH

name: World Vision International
description: World Vision focuses on improving child well-being through health, nutrition, WASH, education, child protection, and livelihoods programming, especially in vulnerable communities. In India, World Vision has run programmes on acute malnutrition management, maternal and newborn health, adolescent girls’ nutrition and anaemia reduction, WASH access, and humanitarian relief after disasters. They recruit programme leads in nutrition, health, livelihoods, and humanitarian response monitoring.

extraInfo.Category: International NGO / Faith-inspired humanitarian and development organisation
extraInfo.Specializations: Child health, nutrition, WASH, livelihoods, disaster response

name: Oxfam International
description: Oxfam campaigns and implements programmes on inequality reduction, humanitarian aid, gender justice, livelihoods, climate resilience, and WASH. In India, Oxfam has historically worked on social protection delivery to marginalized groups, public health in humanitarian contexts (especially WASH and primary care in emergencies), and gender-responsive budgeting. They recruit policy specialists, humanitarian program managers, WASH coordinators, and research & advocacy officers.

extraInfo.Specializations: Inequality, gender justice, WASH, humanitarian response, social protection

name: Plan International
description: Plan International focuses on advancing children’s rights and equality for girls. Areas include adolescent health, menstrual hygiene, SRH education, child protection, nutrition, and education in emergencies. Plan International works in South Asia on adolescent SRH, gender-transformative programming, and resilience in humanitarian settings. They recruit SRH advisors, adolescent health specialists, gender and protection officers, and programme managers.

extraInfo.Specializations: Child rights, adolescent health, SRH, gender equality, education in emergencies

name: Nutrition International
description: Nutrition International supports large-scale nutrition interventions, including iron-folic acid supplementation in adolescents and pregnant women, vitamin A supplementation, salt and flour fortification, and anaemia reduction strategies. In India, they work closely with state governments on anaemia-free initiatives, fortification of staples, and maternal nutrition counselling. They recruit nutrition specialists, programme managers, monitoring & evaluation advisors, and policy/advocacy analysts.

extraInfo.Specializations: Micronutrient supplementation, anaemia, maternal and child nutrition, fortification

name: Management Sciences for Health (MSH)
description: MSH strengthens health systems with a focus on pharmaceutical management, TB and MDR-TB program support, laboratory systems, and antimicrobial stewardship. It works with ministries of health to build governance, improve supply chains and rational drug use, and scale quality of care. MSH and its projects recruit TB technical advisors, pharmaceutical management specialists, AMR and stewardship experts, and health governance consultants in LMICs including India.

extraInfo.Category: International NGO / Global health technical assistance organisation
extraInfo.Specializations: Pharmaceutical systems, TB, AMR, health systems governance

name: Abt Global (formerly Abt Associates)
description: Abt is a mission-driven global research and implementation firm. In health, it supports health systems strengthening, private sector engagement for TB and urban health, primary care quality improvement, social and behavior change, digital health platforms, and rigorous monitoring & evaluation. In India, Abt-affiliated projects have supported urban health systems and tuberculosis private provider engagement. They recruit health systems analysts, economists, project managers, and evaluation specialists.

extraInfo.Category: International NGO / Global research & implementation firm
extraInfo.Specializations: Health systems, private sector engagement, NCDs, digital health, evaluation

name: ICF
description: ICF is a global consulting and analytics company working with governments, multilaterals, and foundations. Public health areas include pandemic preparedness, health security, immunization strategy, climate and health risk, digital health, and health communication. They recruit public health analysts, health security advisors, climate and health experts, data scientists, and evaluation specialists for South Asia-focused and global projects that include India.

extraInfo.Category: International NGO / Consulting and analytics firm
extraInfo.Specializations: Global health security, climate & health, health policy, evaluation, data systems

name: Chemonics International
description: Chemonics implements large donor-funded programmes in global health, governance, and supply chain. In health, they manage procurement and last-mile delivery of medicines and diagnostics, strengthen national logistics systems, and support HIV, TB, and malaria control programmes. They often recruit supply chain experts, health system strengthening specialists, M&E leads, and programme chiefs of party for projects that include India or South Asia nodes.

extraInfo.Specializations: Supply chain, HIV, malaria, TB, health systems, private sector engagement

name: EngenderHealth
description: EngenderHealth focuses on rights-based family planning, comprehensive sexuality education, safe motherhood, post-partum contraception, and gender-based violence response within public health systems. In South Asia, the organisation supports health worker training, quality improvement in reproductive health services, and respectful maternity care. They recruit SRH technical advisors, gender specialists, program managers, and quality improvement leads.

extraInfo.Specializations: Sexual and reproductive health, family planning, gender-based violence response

name: WaterAid
description: WaterAid works to improve access to safe drinking water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) in low-resource settings. In India, WaterAid supports rural and urban sanitation systems, faecal sludge management, hygiene behaviour change, menstrual hygiene management, and WASH in schools and health facilities, linking WASH to disease prevention and dignity. They recruit WASH specialists, behaviour change and IEC experts, MEL officers, and programme managers at national and state levels.

extraInfo.Specializations: WASH, public health engineering, behaviour change, urban sanitation, hygiene in health facilities

name: PATH Foundation / India country office
description: PATH India works with central and state governments, manufacturers, startups, and donors to accelerate access to lifesaving health technologies. Work includes TB diagnostic scale-up, oxygen ecosystems for critical care, immunization logistics, advanced cold chain, digital health platforms for PHC, and NCD screening models. They recruit programme officers, biomedical engineers, health systems consultants, and policy/advocacy staff, often state-embedded.

extraInfo.Category: International NGO / Country office of global health nonprofit
extraInfo.Specializations: Primary care, digital health, TB, oxygen ecosystems, immunization innovation

name: ACCESS Health International
description: ACCESS Health International is a global think tank and advisory group that works with governments and private sector partners on health financing, digital health platforms, elderly care models, and primary health care reforms. In India, it has supported Ayushman Bharat policy dialogue, health insurance design, and digital health infrastructure. They recruit health financing analysts, digital health strategists, public health researchers, and programme managers.

extraInfo.Category: International NGO / Health systems think tank and technical partner
extraInfo.Specializations: Health financing, digital health, primary health care, ageing, health innovation

name: PATH's Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI partner note: CEPI)
description: CEPI funds and coordinates vaccine R&D for emerging infectious diseases with pandemic potential. India is a critical vaccine manufacturing hub, and CEPI partners with Indian manufacturers, research institutes, and regulators to accelerate rapid vaccine development platforms and equitable access. CEPI recruits vaccine R&D specialists, regulatory affairs experts, epidemiologists, clinical trial operations staff, and manufacturing partnership leads.

extraInfo.Specializations: Vaccine R&D for epidemic threats, pandemic preparedness, manufacturing partnerships

name: Asian Development Bank (ADB)
description: ADB funds large-scale infrastructure and systems reform projects across Asia. In health, this includes pandemic preparedness financing, public health emergency operations centers, climate-resilient health infrastructure, regional disease surveillance networks, and primary health care systems strengthening. India is one of ADB’s largest member countries. ADB recruits health economists, health systems specialists, climate and health planners, and monitoring & evaluation professionals for sovereign and technical assistance projects.

extraInfo.Specializations: Health financing, pandemic preparedness, climate and health resilience, health infrastructure

name: World Organisation for Animal Health (WOAH, formerly OIE)
description: WOAH sets international standards for animal health, zoonotic disease surveillance, AMR stewardship in animal use, and safe trade of animals and animal products. Its work links veterinary services with public health systems using a One Health framework. For India and the South Asia region, WOAH supports veterinary capacity building, outbreak detection, and reporting systems for transboundary animal diseases. They recruit veterinarians, epidemiologists, AMR specialists, and surveillance officers.

extraInfo.Specializations: Zoonoses, veterinary public health, AMR in animal health, One Health surveillance

name: World Resources Institute (WRI)
description: WRI is a global research and policy organisation working on environment, cities, and climate. In India, WRI India works on sustainable cities, clean air, transport safety, climate resilience, and heat-health risk reduction. Much of this overlaps with public health, including road injury prevention and air pollution exposure reduction. They recruit researchers and programme managers in environmental health, road safety, urban health resilience, and climate & health policy.

extraInfo.Specializations: Air quality and health, climate resilience, urban health, transport and road safety

name: Vital Voices / Gender-focused networks (public health intersection)
description: Vital Voices invests in women leaders addressing issues including gender-based violence response systems, SRH access, and social protection for vulnerable women and girls. The work intersects with public health in areas such as GBV crisis response, trauma-informed care, survivor services, and economic resilience. They recruit programme managers, advocacy specialists, monitoring & evaluation officers, and gender-based violence response advisors across regions including South Asia.

extraInfo.Category: International NGO / Advocacy and capacity-building network
extraInfo.Specializations: Gender-based violence response, women's health leadership, community systems strengthening

name: PATH / Coalition for Access to Medical Oxygen (Oxygen alliances)
description: Multiple global partners, often convened or supported technically by PATH and similar global health actors, are working with governments to scale reliable medical oxygen ecosystems after COVID-19. India is a major focus for oxygen generation plants, biomedical maintenance systems, and training of clinical and biomedical staff in oxygen therapy. Roles include biomedical engineers, health systems strengthening specialists, supply chain/logistics coordinators, and field implementation managers.

extraInfo.Specializations: Medical oxygen systems, critical care access, device quality, biomedical engineering

name: Solidaridad Network
description: Solidaridad works with producers and workers in agriculture and informal industries to improve sustainability, labour conditions, occupational health, and climate resilience. In India, this includes informal sector worker health (heat stress, chemical exposure), gender inclusion, and livelihood security, which are strongly linked to public health and social determinants of health. They recruit programme managers in worker health and safety, ESG/social compliance, gender, and climate adaptation.

extraInfo.Category: International NGO / Sustainability and livelihoods organisation
extraInfo.Specializations: Sustainable livelihoods, worker health and safety, environmental health, climate resilience

name: Helen Keller Intl
description: Helen Keller Intl focuses on preventing vision loss, controlling neglected tropical diseases, and reducing malnutrition, especially micronutrient deficiencies. In South Asia, the organisation supports vitamin A supplementation, deworming, nutrition counselling for mothers, and screening/referral for eye conditions. They recruit nutrition programme managers, M&E officers, NTD coordinators, policy/advocacy specialists, and public health optometry/eye health experts.

extraInfo.Specializations: Nutrition, vitamin A supplementation, eye health, NTDs

name: The Carter Center
description: The Carter Center leads global disease elimination campaigns (Guinea worm, trachoma, river blindness) and works on mental health policy and access to care in underserved settings. While historically more focused in Africa, its technical work on NTDs, surveillance, and mental health systems is globally influential and used for benchmarking in Asia. They recruit epidemiologists, NTD elimination specialists, data managers, and mental health systems advisors.

extraInfo.Specializations: Neglected tropical diseases, mental health policy, peace and health linkages

name: PATH / Digital Square (Global Digital Health)
description: Digital Square is a global initiative that accelerates open, interoperable digital health tools for LMIC governments. India is both a contributor and test bed for large-scale digital public health infrastructure. Work includes health information systems design, data governance, interoperability standards, and digital health workforce capacity. They recruit product managers, health informatics specialists, interoperability architects, and implementation leads.

extraInfo.Specializations: Digital health platforms, health data exchange, interoperability, health informatics workforce

name: UN Women
description: UN Women supports gender-responsive policy, prevention and response to gender-based violence, women's economic security, and leadership in governance. Much of this overlaps with public health, including GBV crisis and referral systems, unpaid care work and mental health, and access to SRH and social protection. In India, UN Women partners with government and civil society on women's safety and empowerment. They recruit gender and GBV programme specialists, policy analysts, and M&E officers.

extraInfo.Specializations: Gender equality, GBV response systems, economic resilience, SRH policy for women and girls

name: UN Environment Programme (UNEP)
description: UNEP is the UN's environmental authority. Its work intersects with public health in areas such as air pollution exposure reduction, mercury and chemical safety, waste management, climate resilience, and zoonotic spillover risks through land-use change. UNEP in India and South Asia engages on clean air action plans, plastic waste reduction, and climate-health co-benefits. They recruit environmental health analysts, air quality specialists, circular economy and waste policy experts, and programme managers.

extraInfo.Specializations: Air pollution and health, climate and health, chemicals and waste, One Health (environment-human-animal)

name: ILO (International Labour Organization)
description: ILO sets international labour standards and supports decent work, social security, occupational health and safety, migrant worker protections, and elimination of child labour. In India, ILO programmes address workplace safety, heat stress, social protection for informal and gig workers, and labour rights for women and migrants. They recruit specialists in occupational health, social protection systems, labour policy, and monitoring & evaluation.

extraInfo.Specializations: Occupational health and safety, informal workers’ welfare, social protection

name: UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)
description: UNHCR protects and supports refugees, asylum seekers, and stateless persons. Health-related work includes access to primary care, immunization, nutrition support, WASH, GBV and mental health services, and outbreak control in displacement settings. In India, UNHCR works with refugee and asylum seeker populations (including urban refugees) on protection and basic services. They recruit public health officers, protection officers, mental health and psychosocial support staff, M&E officers, and programme managers.

extraInfo.Specializations: Refugee health, mental health and psychosocial support, protection systems, humanitarian response

name: International Rescue Committee (IRC)
description: IRC responds to humanitarian crises by delivering health care, nutrition, WASH, child protection, cash/voucher assistance, and GBV survivor services. While IRC’s large operations are in acute crisis settings, it also engages in policy and technical assistance work relevant to South Asia, including refugee health systems, emergency SRH, and GBV response systems. They recruit health coordinators, SRH in emergencies specialists, GBV advisors, WASH engineers, and M&E staff.

extraInfo.Specializations: Humanitarian health, SRH in crises, GBV response, WASH, cash and basic needs
